name.japanese: モンブラン・ノーランド

keyMoments.title: Mont Blanc Noland's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Noland is introduced as a fearless explorer, botanist, and admiral who dives into the ocean to catch a massive fish to feed his hungry crew.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of the legendary explorer whose story becomes central to the Skypiea arc.
keyMoments.quote: I am an explorer from the North Sea!

keyMoments.title: Noland Hears the Golden Bell
keyMoments.description: During a storm, Noland hears the distant Golden Bell ringing, which guides him toward Jaya.
keyMoments.significance: The bell becomes a central symbol connecting Noland to Shandora and eventually to Kalgara.

keyMoments.title: Noland Kills Kashigami
keyMoments.description: Noland beheads the giant snake god Kashigami to save Mousse from being sacrificed, horrifying the Shandia people.
keyMoments.significance: This heroic but culturally insensitive action creates the central conflict between Noland and the Shandia.

keyMoments.title: Noland Promises to Cure Tree Fever
keyMoments.description: Noland promises to cure the entire Shandia village of Tree Fever by sunset, demonstrating his confidence in science over superstition.
keyMoments.significance: This promise becomes the foundation of trust between Noland and the Shandia people.
keyMoments.quote: I will lift the curse and cure the disease, but I need time!

abilities.description: Noland demonstrates exceptional swordsmanship by beheading the massive snake Kashigami with a single strike.
As a skilled botanist, Noland diagnoses Tree Fever and knows how to cure it using Conine from the Kona Tree.

relationships.description: Noland and Kalgara begin as enemies after Noland kills Kashigami and disrupts the Shandia's sacred ritual. This initial antagonism will later transform into one of the deepest friendships in One Piece.

evolutionMoments.description: Kalgara attacks Noland for killing Kashigami and profaning their sacred ritual.

reveals.information: Mont Blanc Noland is an admiral, explorer, and botanist from the Lvneel Kingdom
Noland possesses exceptional swordsmanship and botanical knowledge

keyMoments.title: Kalgara's First Appearance
keyMoments.description: Kalgara is introduced as the 'Demon of Shandora,' attacking intruders on Jaya by throwing a massive anchor at their ship and jumping aboard to fight them.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of the greatest Shandia warrior whose legacy shapes the entire Skypiea arc.

keyMoments.title: Kalgara Attacks Noland
keyMoments.description: Outraged by Noland's killing of Kashigami, Kalgara swims to the altar and attacks the explorer, refusing to listen to his explanations.
keyMoments.significance: The first confrontation between Noland and Kalgara establishes their initial antagonism.

abilities.description: Kalgara demonstrates immense physical strength by throwing a massive ship anchor and attacking enemies with overwhelming force.

relationships.description: Mousse is Kalgara's daughter. Despite his love for her, he allows her to be sacrificed to save the village from Tree Fever.

evolutionMoments.description: Kalgara allows his daughter Mousse to be sacrificed to Kashigami.

relationships.description: Kalgara initially views Noland as an enemy who has profaned their sacred ritual by killing Kashigami.

evolutionMoments.description: Kalgara attacks Noland for killing Kashigami.

relationships.description: Seto is Kalgara's son-in-law, married to Mousse.

reveals.information: Kalgara is known as the 'Demon of Shandora' and the 'Great Warrior of Shandora'
Kalgara has a daughter named Mousse and a son-in-law named Seto

keyMoments.title: Mousse at the Sacrificial Altar
keyMoments.description: Mousse, Kalgara's daughter, is brought to the Sacrificial Altar to be offered to Kashigami. She willingly accepts this fate to save her village from Tree Fever.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the selflessness and courage of the Shandia people.

keyMoments.title: Mousse Saved by Noland
keyMoments.description: Just as Kashigami is about to devour Mousse, Noland jumps in and kills the giant snake, saving her life.
keyMoments.significance: This rescue sets up the conflict and eventual friendship between Noland and Kalgara.

reveals.information: Mousse is Kalgara's daughter and is married to Seto

keyMoments.title: Seto Suffering from Tree Fever
keyMoments.description: Noland's crew discovers Seto, a young Shandian man dying from Tree Fever, desperately trying to scrape the disease's green stains off his arm with a rock.
keyMoments.significance: Seto becomes the first person Noland saves, demonstrating the explorer's compassion and medical knowledge.
keyMoments.quote: I wanted to be like him one day, but instead I'm going to die like this.

relationships.description: Seto is Kalgara's son-in-law, married to Mousse.

reveals.information: Seto is afflicted with Tree Fever
Seto is married to Mousse and is Kalgara's son-in-law

keyMoments.title: Chiya Declares the Sacrifice
keyMoments.description: The dying priest Chiya, covered in green stains from Tree Fever, declares that Shandia is cursed and demands that a girl be sacrificed to the gods to save the village.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the desperate situation that leads to Mousse's near-sacrifice and Noland's intervention.
keyMoments.quote: Shandia is cursed! To save the village, a girl must be offered to the Sacrificial Altar!

reveals.information: Chiya is dying from Tree Fever

keyMoments.title: Kashigami the Snake God Appears
keyMoments.description: The giant snake Kashigami, worshipped as a deity by the Shandia, emerges from the water to receive the sacrifice of Mousse.
keyMoments.significance: Introduction of the creature that symbolizes the Shandia's faith and sets up Noland's heroic intervention.

keyMoments.title: Kashigami Killed by Noland
keyMoments.description: Mont Blanc Noland beheads Kashigami with his sword, killing the snake god instantly and saving Mousse.
keyMoments.significance: The death of Kashigami creates the central conflict between Noland and the Shandia people.

abilities.description: Kashigami is a massive serpent hundreds of meters long, capable of swallowing humans whole.

reveals.information: Kashigami is a giant snake worshipped as a god by the Shandia
Kashigami is killed by Mont Blanc Noland

keyMoments.title: Dr. Honner Diagnoses Tree Fever
keyMoments.description: Dr. Honner, Noland's ship doctor, diagnoses Seto's condition as Tree Fever and helps prepare the cure.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the medical expertise of Noland's crew.

abilities.description: Honner can diagnose diseases like Tree Fever and assist in medical treatments.

relationships.description: Honner serves as the ship doctor on Noland's expedition fleet.

reveals.information: Honner is the doctor aboard Noland's expedition fleet
